alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 25 at 8:18AM PST until December 27 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Abnormally high tides around 7.1 to 7.2 feet are expected. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will occur each morning between 630 AM and 815 AM. Later on, large surf is expected Thursday through at least Saturday. During this time, there is the potential for warning level surf of 15 feet across west facing beaches of Ventura county and in excess of 10 feet across LA county beaches. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.2 to 6.6 feet, may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. This could require the issuance of a coastal flood advisory as we draw closer to the event.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.
